metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3902 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerabilities in the setup process in phpMyAdmin 4.0.x before 4.0.10.10, 4.2.x before 4.2.13.3, 4.3.x before 4.3.13.1, and 4.4.x before 4.4.6.1 allow remote attackers to hijack the authentication of administrators for requests that modify the configuration file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3902` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

phpmyadmin - 4:4.4.6.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:4.4.6.1-1').
